title: Trump Revives Trade War, Threatening Steep Aug. 1 Tariffs on Allies
summary: President Trump said Japan and South Korea would face tariffs of 25 percent unless they reached an agreement with the United States. Other countries received notice of higher levies.

title: As Renewed U.S. Tariffs Loom, Emerging Economies Turn to One Another
summary: With President Trump preparing to revive tariffs this week, some of the world’s biggest exporters are planning a future less dependent on trade with the United States.

title: Here Are Trump’s New Tariff Threats
summary: President Trump has told 14 countries that they will face tariffs of at least 25 percent on Aug. 1 if they don’t reach agreements by then.

title: Trump Looks to Avoid Casting Blame in Texas Flood as Democrats Question Cuts
summary: The White House rebuked critics for raising questions about the administration’s efforts to shrink federal agencies that deal with disaster preparedness and response.

title: Texas Flood Victims: What We Know
summary: A beloved teacher, child and adult campers, camp directors and a counselor are among at least 104 people who have died in the flooding in Central Texas.

title: Three Big Questions After the Texas Floods
summary: The Trump administration and its predecessors will face scrutiny over the disaster that has killed more than 100 people.

title: Trump and Netanyahu Meet Amid Gaza Cease-Fire Negotiations
summary: The two confronted an array of high-stakes Middle East issues. But first they took a victory lap, including the Israeli leader telling President Trump he had nominated him for a Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Trump Administration Acknowledges Lack of Evidence for Jeffrey Epstein ‘Client List’
summary: After Attorney General Pam Bondi promised big revelations for months, the Justice Department noted a lack of evidence for conspiracy theories, including a “client list” and a jailhouse murder.

title: I.R.S. Says Churches Can Endorse Candidates From the Pulpit
summary: In a court filing, the tax agency said a decades-old ban on campaigning by tax-exempt groups should not apply to houses of worship speaking to their own members.

title: Russia Confirms Death of Minister Hours After Kremlin Dismissed Him
summary: Roman V. Starovoyt, the transport minister, had governed the Kursk region before Ukrainian forces occupied part of it in 2024.

title: Trump Pledges to Send More Weapons to Ukraine
summary: “They have to be able to defend themselves,” the president said, appearing to signal a reversal after his administration paused some weapons transfers just last week.

title: After Mamdani’s Win, Some Democrats Are Determined to Stop Him
summary: Though Zohran Mamdani scored a resounding victory in New York City’s Democratic primary, some in his own party are strategizing about how to defeat him in November.

title: It’s Hard to Create a Third Party, Even for Elon Musk
summary: Building a viable new political party to rival the Democrats and Republicans is enormously difficult and expensive. Small wonder it hasn’t been done.

title: Haiti’s Landmark Oloffson Hotel is Destroyed in an Apparent Arson Fire
summary: Haiti’s famed Oloffson Hotel, a cultural landmark and celebrity haven, was incinerated amid rising violence by gangs that control most of the country’s capital.

title: TSA to End Shoe Removal Requirement at Airport Security Checkpoints
summary: Most passengers had been required to remove their footwear at checkpoints since 2006, a policy later eased only for members of trusted traveler programs.

title: The Brothers Who Came Face to Face in Myanmar’s War
summary: Bloody conflict has splintered many families in Myanmar over the past four years. But for one set of siblings, a surprise reunion was joyful, if bittersweet.

title: What to Know About P.O.W.s in Myanmar’s Brutal Civil War
summary: As the rebels have gained ground, they have detained thousands of prisoners of war. Their enemy, the junta, keeps few captives.

title: This Carmaker Embodies the Industrial Threat China Poses to the U.S.
summary: China’s national champion carmaker BYD embodies a state-led industrial model that America may no longer be able to compete with.

title: The Ruthless Ambition of Stephen Miller
summary: The most powerful man in the West Wing is getting what he wants. Is Trump?

title: Macron’s U.K. State Visit: Migrants and the War in Ukraine Are on the Agenda
summary: President Emmanuel Macron’s state visit to Britain, which begins Tuesday, will be heavy on pageantry. But both he and Prime Minister Keir Starmer hope for practical results.

title: Why Are Protesters in Mexico City Angry at Remote Workers?
summary: Top concerns include the displacement of longtime residents as rents and food prices surge. Ire over the influx of well-heeled foreigners has been building for years.

title: N.Y.P.D. Investigates the Death of an 18-Year-Old in a Bronx Police Station
summary: Saniyah Cheatham is said to have hanged herself early Saturday after she was arrested in an assault case. Friends said she had been in good spirits a day before.

title: Caltech Settles Case Accusing It of Misleading Students
summary: A student who paid thousands for a tech boot camp said it was “a Caltech program in name only.”
